intro: Jurinea armeniaca, commonly known as Armenian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. Its succulent leaves and compact growth habit help it conserve water in its native habitat.
